note: DECIMAL NUMBER: A number represented in the base-ten number system using the digits 0-9.
FILE: An organized collection of related data.
title: EXPRESSION: A combination of one or more operations, constants and variables

A number represented in the base-16 number system using the digits 0-9 plus A,B,C,D,E,F. INTRINSIC FUNCTION: A function (usually a complicated function) that may be "built-in" to the computer's ROM and may be used directly in a BASIC statement
An expression which is either True or False: if True,-1 is returned; if False, is returned
The language used directly by the Computer, written as binary-coded instructions. PORT: One of 256 channels through which data can be input to or output from the Computer

note: LEVEL II BASIC is stored in ROM.
title: Random Access Memory; memory available to the user for writing programs and storing data. ROM: Read Only Memory; memory which is permanently programmed and may be read but not written into
